segments.text: I see the water flowing endlessly from the faucet, drenching everything around it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman in front of the sink seems entirely absorbed in polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle forming at her feet, yet she doesn’t seem to care at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so oblivious to the chaos right under her nose?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window illuminates the kitchen beautifully.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the garden outside, so calm and inviting, which makes the scene inside even more chaotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing dangerously on that stool; it looks like it could tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl, with her arm outstretched, is just waiting for her cookie like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I am genuinely surprised at how this serene kitchen has turned into a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of someone slipping on that wet floor gives me chills.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a twinge of worry for those children; what if they fall?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This all feels so reckless; I wonder if the woman will ever notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Right now, the world outside seems so far removed from the risks unfolding inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if the kitchen is a bubble of mischief, while life outside remains untouched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman looks up soon, before something goes terribly wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
